properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from  Suwannee River to Keaton Beach out 20 NM; Waters from Mexico Beach to Apalachicola FL from 20 to 60 NM; Coastal Waters From  Ochlockonee River to Apalachicola FL out to 20 Nm; Waters from Suwannee River to Apalachicola FL from 20 to 60 NM
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued January 4 at 2:45AM EST until January 4 at 4:15AM EST by NWS Tallahassee FL
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Coastal Waters From  Ochlockonee River to Apalachicola FL out to 20
Nm...
Coastal waters from  Suwannee River to Keaton Beach out 20 NM...
Waters from Mexico Beach to Apalachicola FL from 20 to 60 NM...
Waters from Suwannee River to Apalachicola FL from 20 to 60 NM...

* Until 415 AM EST/315 AM CST/.

* At 245 AM EST/145 AM CST/, severe thunderstorms capable of
producing waterspouts were located along a line extending from 7 nm
west of V Tower to 59 nm south of Empire Mica Wreck, moving
northeast at 25 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts 34 knots or greater.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect wind gusts in excess of 34 knots...suddenly higher
waves...frequent lightning...and heavy downpours.
Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats...damage
vessels...and create suddenly higher waves. Make sure all
on board are in a secure location and wearing life
jackets.

* Locations impacted include...
S Tower and V Tower.
properties.instruction: Move to safe harbor until hazardous weather passes.
